Known problems in CITE


Known problems in CITE

The following are some of the known problems. There might be other bugs, if you encounter any please email them to ssuresh@mti.sgi.com.
  1. When LNO does not do optimization on a loop, it could be due to several problems. One of them is dependence problems. CITE does not print out the details. In other case LNO might not optimize because of a scalar that it couldnt expand. The name of the scalar comes out wrong.
  2. CITE uses several heuristics to correlate the information produced by the code generator to the post LNO loop structure. If the code generator fails to produce the relevant information, the correlation will be wrong sometimes. I have seen examples of this for DO WHILE loops.
  3. Sometimes reverse if conversion destroys failure notes from the software pipeliner. There might be no information on the reason the inner loop did not software pipeline.

Suresh Srinivas (ssuresh@mti)
Questions and comments to ssuresh@mti.sgi.com.
May 30th 1996
